p: Increasing warm weather—an outcome predicted to occur with high likelihood—has a direct impact on companion animal health. Several animal welfare organizations have already reported that incidences of dogs dying in hot cars are increasing (British Veterinary Association 2019; Shih et al. 2019). Increase in warm temperature also has an alarming correlation with an increase in dog bites (Ahmed et al. 2019) and rabies infections in dogs (Lachica et al. 2020). An increase in droughts may also worsen the rabies epidemic as rabies infection has been negatively correlated with precipitation (Courtin et al. 2000; Lachica et al. 2020).
